In this SectionSDSULife at SDSUHousingDiningStudent UnionClubs & OrganizationsPerformance GroupsAztec Recreation CenterHealth & Well-beingSupport & ServicesAthleticsLife at SDSUThere is nothing like the Aztec Experience.Live a Good LifeHousingWhen you live on campus, you can immerse yourself in college life and take advantage of the opportunities right outside your door.
								Learn More About
							DiningGetting Around
Be Part of the Aztec Community#GoAztecsSDSU is alive with possibilities. You can see top performers and musicians at Viejas Arena and the Cal Coast Credit Union Open Air Theatre, work out in modern facilities and meet friends at both campus and nearby restaurants before cheering on our Division 1 athletics teams.Concerts at SDSUAztec Recreation CenterSouth Campus PlazaSDSU AthleticsAztec NightsAztec Nights provide late-night entertainment, games and activities for you, your friends and the new friends you will meet.
									Learn More About
								Clubs & OrganizationsThings To Do Near Campus
By Students, For StudentsAssociated Students, a student-run organization, plans events and programming like GreenFest; manages the Aztec Recreation Center and the Conrad Prebys Aztec Student Union, among other facilities; and works to ensure that your Aztec experience will be unforgettable.Since its inception, Aztecs Rock Hunger has raised millions pounds of food for the Jacobs and Cushman San Diego Food Bank to fight food insecurity in our community.Aztecs Rock Hungeropen3.6mpounds of food raised by Aztecs Rock HungerAztec Recreation maintains campus facilities and offers health and fitness programs as well as adventures that make the Aztec Experience active and exciting.Aztec Recreation Centeropen17,240Aztec Recreation members, a record highAssociated Students' boards, committees and commissions offer opportunities for current students to become active members and leaders within the SDSU community.Associated Studentsopen$29moperating budget for Associated Students
		Our Values
		
	We honor the value and dignity of all individuals by nurturing a university environment that affirms and leverages a diversity of identities, traditions, heritages, perspectives and experiences.
								Learn More
							Student Cultural CentersDiversity ResourcesCommunity of CareNeed support or just have questions? You are never alone – holistic programs created for SDSU students ensure your university experience is healthy and successful.Health & WellnessSDSU’s community of care focuses on supporting people and providing resources dedicated to your complete well-being.Counseling, Psychological SupportWe offer counseling, group therapy, time with therapy dogs Baxter and Luna, workshops and more to help you address your concerns and personal growth goals.Services for StudentsHave a question about student activities, scholarships or financial aid?If you are looking for answers to your financial questions, searching for an internship or job, want to learn about cultural centers and activities or connect with students who share your interests and passions, the Division of Student Affairs and Campus Diversity is here for you.Student Affairs and Campus Diversity
